Joel_Crouse:
{{short description|American country music singer|bot=PearBOT 5}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Joel Crouse | image = Joel Crouse at Countryfest 2013.jpg | birth_name = Joel Thomas Crouse | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1992|6|14}} | birth_place = [[Holland, Massachusetts]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter musician | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | instrument = Vocals/guitar/piano | website = {{URL|www.joelcrouse.com/}} | caption = Image of Joel Crouse at Countryfest 2013 }} '''Joel Thomas Crouse''' (born June 14, 1992) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. He released his most recent EP, wasteLAnd on his label, Hum Records in August 2020.{{cite news|title=How Joel Crouse Went From Opening for Taylor Swift to 'Food Stamps'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/joel-crouse-taylor-swift-tour-1046836/|accessdate=August 20, 2020|newspaper=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=August 20, 2020}} ==Early life== Joel Crouse grew up in [[Holland, Massachusetts]]. He attended [[Tantasqua Regional High School]] and graduated when he was sixteen.{{cite news |url=http://www.telegram.com/article/20140606/NEWS/306069598/0 |title= Country singer Crouse set for Tantasqua |date=June 6, 2014 |work=Telegram.com}} ==Career== While still living in Holland, Crouse founded a local [[pop rock]] band called Leaving Stafford.{{cite news |url=http://www.telegram.com/article/20130204/NEWS/102049949/1246 |title=Ex-Holland resident Joel Crouse's country single 'If You Want Some' hits 59 on Billboard |author= Richard Duckett |date=February 4, 2013 |work=Telegram.com }} He signed a short-lived demo deal with [[Epic Records]] in 2009.{{cite news |url=http://www.masslive.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2010/04/holland_teen_joel_t_crouse_sin.html |title= Holland teen Joel T. Crouse sings backup on soon-to-be released Cyrus-Crow single|author= Kathryn Roy |work= The Republican|date= April 13, 2010 }} In 2011, Crouse signed with [[Show Dog-Universal Music]], and toured with [[Toby Keith]] and [[The Band Perry]]. He released his debut single "If You Want Some" in February 2013.{{cite web|author= |url=http://countrymusicpride.com/joel-crouse-releases-debut-single-if-you-want-some-february-5-2013-song-review/ |title=Joel Crouse Releases Debut Single "If You Want Some" February 5, 2013 – Song Review |publisher=Countrymusicpride.com |date=February 4, 2013 |accessdate=April 24, 2020}} It received three-and-a-half stars from Taste of Country reviewer Billy Dukes, who thought that Crouse "sings with more confidence than 20 years provides most artists".{{cite web|author=Billy Dukes |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/joel-crouse-if-you-want-some/ |title=Joel Crouse, 'If You Want Some' – Song Review |website=Tasteofcountry.com |date= |accessdate=April 24, 2020}} The song, which he wrote with Jamie Houston and [[Luke Laird]], debuted at number 59 on the [[Country Airplay]] charts in January 2013. His album, ''Even the River Runs'', was released on August 19, 2014, and entered the Billboard Top Country Albums at No. 20.{{cite news |author=Matt Bjorke |date=August 27, 2014 |title=Country Album Sales Report – August 27, 2014 |url=http://roughstock.com/news/country-album-sales-report-august-27-2014/ |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903151553/http://roughstock.com/news/country-album-sales-report-august-27-2014/ |archive-date=September 3, 2014 |access-date=September 11, 2014 |work=Roughstock}} Sales figure given here [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1my6EGZTp0s3AnWKYoLxrU0uZlyN3-S_wcJeBuzrtT3U/edit?pli=1#gid=0] Crouse made his [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut on April 18, 2014.{{cite news |url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/a-and-e/music/joel-crouse-celebrates-new-album-with-grand-ole-opry-performance/article/398741 |title= Joel Crouse celebrates new album with Grand Ole Opry performance|author= Markos Papadatos |work= Digital Journal|date= August 22, 2014 }} From May to July 2013, he toured with [[Taylor Swift]] as a part of her [[Red Tour]] as one of her opening acts, playing before the other opening act, [[Ed Sheeran]].{{cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/joel-crouse-taylor-swift-tour-1046836/ |title= How Joel Crouse Went From Opening For Taylor Swift to 'Food Stamps'|author= Joseph Hudak |magazine= Rolling Stone|date= August 20, 2020 }} On July 10, 2020, Crouse released his first feature collaboration with German DJ Wave Wave, "Broke". Crouse released "wasteLAnd" EP on his label, Hum Records, in August 2020. "On My Way" was the lead single co-written by [[Ed Sheeran]] and the Official Music Video features [[Darius Rucker]], Ed Sheeran, and [[Lucy Hale]]. [[American Songwriter]] published an interview with Crouse about the EP, which "chronicles Crouse’s roller-coaster experience with the music business. [Crouse said] 'I had gone from touring with Taylor Swift and Ed Sheeran and Darius Rucker,' he says. 'Four years later, my business manager ends up going to jail. I ended up getting in this horrible deal that I had to fight my way out of. And at this time, I’m broke, too. I’m on food stamps, trying to survive. I end up going to write a song with Todd Clark and he was like, ‘What’s going on in your life?’ I told him, ‘Dude, I feel like I’m just surviving.’ That started everything. I just started writing everything that was going on around me.'”{{cite news |url=https://americansongwriter.com/wasteland-album-joel-crouse-interview/ |title= Joel Crouse Discusses Finding His Voice Again, Writing For New EP 'wasteLAnd'|author= Katherine Yeske Taylor |work= American Songwriter|date= August 7, 2020 }} In December 2020, [[Darius Rucker]] included Crouse in SPIN Magazine's ''The 35 Best Lesser-Known Artists of the Last 35 Years, Picked by 35 Well-Known Artists'', saying "Joel Crouse has a sense of melody like no one I have been around. I think that comes from having such a unique voice, it’s so original."{{cite news |url=https://www.spin.com/featured/the-35-best-lesser-known-artists-of-the-last-35-years-picked-by-35-well-known-artists/ |title= The 35 Best Lesser-Known Artists of the Last 35 Years, Picked by 35 Well-Known Artists|author= SPIN Staff |work= SPIN Magazine|date= December 6, 2020 }} ==Discography== ===EPs=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! Title ! Director |- | 2013 ! scope="row"| "If You Want Some"{{cite news|title=Crouse debuts video|url=http://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=7234|accessdate=June 21, 2013|newspaper=[[Country Standard Time]]|date=June 20, 2013}} | [[Chris Hicky]] |- | 2020 ! scope="row"| "On My Way" | Robbie Norris |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.joelcrouse.com/ Official website] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Crouse, Joel}} [[Category:1992 births]] [[Category:American male singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Holland, Massachusetts]] [[Category:Show Dog-Universal Music artists]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Massachusetts]] [[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]] [[Category:21st-century American male singers]]
